title: Calculate Windchill Danger
brief: Understand how wind speed dramatically increases cold weather danger through windchill effect.
steps: Step 1: Measure or estimate current air temperature.
Step 2: Measure or estimate wind speed in kilometers per hour.
Step 3: Apply windchill calculation - example: -10Â°C with 27.8 kph (15 knot) wind equals -23Â°C windchill.
Step 4: Remember you create wind by moving - skiing, running, or working around aircraft.
Step 5: Plan activities considering windchill, not just air temperature.
Step 6: Seek wind protection when possible to reduce effective temperature.
warnings: Windchill can make survivable temperatures deadly.
Movement creates additional wind even in still air.
Extremely hazardous conditions exist when wind and low temperature combine.
